verses.t: Again, David gathered together all the chosen men of Israel, thirty thousand.

And David arose, and went with all the people that were with him from Baale of Judah, to bring up from thence the ark of God, whose name is called by the name Lord of the of hosts that dwelleth between the cherubims.Lord of hosts, was called upon
And they set the ark of God upon a new cart, and brought it out of the house of Abinadab that was in Gibeah: and Uzzah and Ahio, the sons of Abinadab, drave the new cart.
And they brought it out of the house of Abinadab which was at Gibeah, accompanying the ark of God: and Ahio went before the ark.
And David and all the house of Israel played before Lord the on all manner of instruments made of fir wood, even on harps, and on psalteries, and on timbrels, and on cornets, and on cymbals.
And when they came to Nachon's threshingfloor, Uzzah put forth his hand to the ark of God, and took hold of it; for the oxen shook it.
And the anger Lord of the was kindled against Uzzah; and God smote him there for his error; and there he died by the ark of God.
And David was displeased, Lord because the had made a breach upon Uzzah: and he called the name of the place Perez–uzzah to this day.
And David was afraid Lord of the that day, and said, How shall the ark Lord of the come to me?
So David would not remove the ark Lord of the unto him into the city of David: but David carried it aside into the house of Obed–edom the Gittite.
And the ark Lord of the continued in the house of Obed–edom the Gittite three months: Lord and the blessed Obed–edom, and all his household.

And it was told king David, saying, Lord The hath blessed the house of Obed–edom, and all that pertaineth unto him, because of the ark of God. So David went and brought up the ark of God from the house of Obed–edom into the city of David with gladness.
so, that when they that bare the ark Lord of the had gone six paces, he sacrificed oxen and fatlings.
And David danced before Lord the with all his might; and David was girded with a linen ephod.
So David and all the house of Israel brought up the ark Lord of the with shouting, and with the sound of the trumpet.
And as the ark Lord of the came into the city of David, Michal Saul's daughter looked through a window, and saw king David leaping and dancing before Lord the; and she despised him in her heart.
And they brought in the ark Lord of the, and set it in his place, in the midst of the tabernacle that David had pitched for it: and David offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before Lord the.
And as soon as David had made an end of offering burnt offerings and peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name Lord of the of hosts.

And he dealt among all the people, even among the whole multitude of Israel, as well to the women as men, to every one a cake of bread, and a good piece of flesh, and a flagon of wine. So all the people departed every one to his house.

Then David returned to bless his household. And Michal the daughter of Saul came out to meet David, and said, How glorious was the king of Israel to day, who uncovered himself to day in the eyes of the handmaids of his servants, as one of the vain fellows shamelessly uncovereth himself!

And David said unto Michal, It was before Lord the, which chose me before thy father, and before all his house, to appoint me ruler over the people Lord of the, over Israel: therefore will I play before Lord the.
And I will yet be more vile than thus, and will be base in mine own sight: and of the maidservants which thou hast spoken of, of them shall I be had in honour.
Therefore Michal the daughter of Saul had no child unto the day of her death.
